snippet: Young people still watch many television shows, but they are streaming them on computers and phones to a greater degree.
abstract: Young people still watch many television shows, but they are streaming them on computers and phones to a greater degree.
lead_paragraph: Americans ages 12 to 34 are spending less time in front of TV sets, even as those 35 and older are spending more, reports Brian Stelter of The New York Times. The divide reveals the effect of Internet videos, social networks, mobile phones and video games - in short, all the alternatives to the television set that are taking up growing slices of the American attention span. Read more »

headline.main: Youths Are Watching, but Less Often on TV
